item.title: Cloud Foundry configuration with SteelToe
item.description: I’ve been playing around with the SteelToe framework for .net apps on Cloud Foundry a bit and it’s been nice overall (I’ll probably write a few more posts about it at some point ðŸ˜Š). While playing around with it the configuration part of it I wasn’t really liking the way settings can be read from the main configuration. Let’s start with a really short primer on how the configuration system works.

item.title: Angular (5) and aspnet core (2) quickstart
item.description: Here is a get-up-and-go style post to get going with the angular CLI and aspnet core. Before we begin, there is a template you can use to set (most, if not more) of this up, but it’s good to know what is going on behind the curtains. First things first. You need some tools installed to get the base project set up. dotnet core SDK Node angular-cli which we’ll install using NPM.
